feed.title: Current watches, warnings, and advisories for United States land zones

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 6:53PM MST until June 27 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
entry.summary:
The Flood Advisory will expire at 7 PM MST this evening for a portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following areas, Cochise and Santa Cruz.
Flood waters have receded. Small stream flooding is no longer expected to pose a threat. Please continue to heed remaining road closures.

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM MST THIS EVENING

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 8:52PM CDT until June 27 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Bismarck ND
entry.summary:
SVRBIS
The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a
* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Sioux County in south central North Dakota... Southern Grant County in south central North Dakota... Southeastern Adams County in southwestern North Dakota...
* Until 945 PM CDT/845 PM MDT/.
* At 851 PM CDT/751 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of New Leipzig to 12 miles northwest of Keldron to near Thunder Hawk, moving east at 50 mph.
HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings.
* Locations impacted include... Shields, Lark, Raleigh, Leith, St. Gertrude, Porcupine, Standing Rock, and Standing Rock Nation.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Adams, ND; Grant, ND; Sioux, ND

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:52PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
entry.summary:
Gusty winds of 45 to 55 mph will continue through 9 pm across the Denver Metro area.
Locations impacted include... Denver, southwestern Aurora, Lakewood, Thornton, Arvada, Westminster, Centennial, Boulder, Broomfield, Highlands Ranch, Commerce City, Littleton, Northglenn, Brighton, Englewood, Wheat Ridge, Lafayette, Golden, Louisville, and Erie.
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near a lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:52PM MDT by NWS Salt Lake City UT
entry.summary:
At 752 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nephi, moving east at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Nephi, Elk Ridge, Rocky Ridge, Mona, Birdseye, and Indianola.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 225 and 241. US Route 89 between mile markers 292 and 307.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 8:47PM CDT until July 1 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant Hill MO
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Platte River near Agency affecting Buchanan County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Platte River near Agency.
* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low-lying areas east of Agency begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 16.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then rise to 16.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall to 16.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise above flood stage Saturday afternoon to 20.5 feet Saturday evening. It will fall below flood stage again early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 27 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
entry.summary:
ISSUED: 06/27/2024 09:00 EXPIRES: 07/01/2024 18:00
The Valley Air District is issuing an Air Quality Alert on June 27, 2024, due to smoke impacts from wildfires in Fresno County including the Fresno June Lightning Complex and Basin Fire in Madera, Fresno, Tulare, and the Valley portion of Kern Counties.
This Air Quality Alert is in effect until the fires are extinguished.
Exposure to particle pollution can cause serious health problems, aggravate lung disease, cause asthma attacks and acute bronchitis, and increase risk of respiratory infection.
Residents are advised to use caution as conditions warrant. In people with heart disease should follow their doctor's advice for dealing with episodes of unhealthy air quality. Short-term exposure to particle pollution has been linked to heart attacks and arrhythmias, according to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
Additionally, older adults/elderly people and children are also more susceptible to consequences of high particulate levels and should avoid prolong exposure, strenuous outdoor activities or heavy exertion, as conditions dictate.
For additional information, call your local San Joaquin Valley Air District office. Modesto 209-557-6400, Fresno 559-230-6000, Bakersfield 661-392-5500
Residents can also follow air quality conditions by downloading the free Valley Air app, available in the Apple store or Google Play.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Fresno, CA; Kern, CA; Madera, CA; Tulare, CA

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:26PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
entry.summary:
An unusually unstable airmass along with very warm surface temperatures are bringing thunderstorms to the North Slope and areas along the Arctic Coast this afternoon through Friday afternoon. Some thunderstorms will be quite strong and capable of producing hail approaching 1 inch in diameter, wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. Most storms will diminish after midnight tonight but a few may continue through the night. Friday afternoon and evening will bring more strong storms. Storms will move from south to north.
When thunder roars, go indoors.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast; Northern Arctic Coast; Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Western Arctic Plains; Howard Pass and the Delong Mountains; Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

cap:parameter.value: Very Strong Thunderstorms Still Possible This Afternoon Through Friday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS Great Falls MT
entry.summary:
Increasing westerly flow aloft and mountain wave activity will bring windy conditions along the Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent high plains beginning this evening.
The strongest winds are expected from 5 pm MDT through midnight tonight when westerly sustained winds of 30 to 40 mph are expected, along with gusts up to 60 mph at times. There will be periods of lighter winds overnight before another wave of stronger northwesterly winds move in during early morning hours on Friday.
In addition to the winds, temperatures tonight will fall into the 30s and 40s and there will be showers and even some higher mountain light snow, creating cold and wet conditions for those outdoors.
Anyone with travel or recreational plans along the Rocky Mountain Front should be prepared for difficult travel with high profile vehicles and poor conditions for outdoor activities. Those planning to be outdoors should be properly dressed for cold and wet weather.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern High Plains

cap:parameter.value: Periods of gusty west to northwesterly winds expected along the Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent high plains this evening through Friday morning

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 3:04PM CDT until June 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Illinois...
Rock River At Afton affecting Rock and Winnebago Counties.
Crawfish River At Milford affecting Jefferson County.
ROCK RIVER near LEBANON-3 E-HWY MM BRIDGE affecting Dodge County.
Wisconsin River At Portage affecting Columbia County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wisconsin River at Portage.
* WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, In the Blackhawk Park area in the Town of Caledonia, Old River Road is closed with water over it. West Lane Road in the Long Lake area is closed with about 4 feet of water over it in places. County Highway V and Oak Knoll Road in the Town of Dekorra have water up to the edge of the pavement. A few homes in the Town of Dekorra area near the river have water in the first floor and there is also flooding of outbuildings and yards.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM CDT Thursday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to hold steady around 17.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 04/28/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 10:47AM AKDT until June 30 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
entry.summary:
Warm daytime and overnight temperatures have continued the melting of high elevation snowpack and glacier ice to produce minor flooding along the Chilkat River. Warm temperatures will continue through the week and into the weekend, causing continued daily crests.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues.
* WHERE...The Chilkat River near areas around Mile Post 14 and 24 of the Haines Highway, near Klukwan and the Chilkat River Bridge.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM AKDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1040 AM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from snowmelt in areas around mile post 14 and 24 of the Haines Highway, near Klukwan and the Chilkat River Bridge. Minor flooding is ongoing, especially near the Chilkat River.
- Please send reports of impacts and pictures of those impacts with specific location information to the National Weather Service forecast office in Juneau by email (juneau.weather@noaa.gov), or via X, or Facebook.
- For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 10:00am the stage was 126.7 feet. Flood Stage is 126.0 feet. Forecast: Crests between 126.0 and 127.0 feet are expected over the next several days. Daily minimums in water levels at the Chilkat River Bridge will occur at around 10pm and daily crests at around 10am are expected.
Impacts: At 126.0 feet: Bankfull stage. Water will begin to flood backyards along the Chilkat River in the village of Klukwan.
At 126.5 feet: Expect flooding of yards and bank erosion near the Jilkaat Kwan Cultural Heritage Center Campus Traditional Knowledge camp in the village of Klukwan. Water will flood lower elevations in backyards along the Chilkat River near Klukwan and start to impact some smokehouse and a river access road. - For the Klehini River: Daily water level peaks at the 26 mile bridge gauge will occur near midnight.
- If you live near or along the Chilkat river, stay alert and be prepared to take action.

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT SUNDAY

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 27 at 9:03AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
entry.summary:
AQAPSR
The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Friday.
This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone concentrations that pose a health risk. Adverse health effects increase as air quality deteriorates.
Ozone is an air contaminant which can cause breathing difficulties for children, older adults, as well as persons with respiratory problems. A decrease in physical activity is recommended.
You are urged to car pool, telecommute or use mass transit. The use of gasoline-powered equipment should be reduced or done late in the day.
For details on this High Pollution Advisory, visit the ADEQ internet site at www.azdeq.gov/forecast/phoenix or call 602-771-2300.

cap:parameter.value: OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA FRIDAY

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 27 at 6:10AM MDT until June 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello ID
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected.
* WHERE...Beaverhead - Lemhi Highlands, Arco/Mud Lake Desert, and Upper Snake River Plain.
* WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 9 PM MDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Unsecured objects may be blown around. Blowing dust is likely, especially near plowed fields. Blowing dust could cause reduced visibilities. Also, strong winds and rough waves on area lakes will create hazardous conditions for small craft.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 4:40PM AKDT until June 28 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
entry.summary:
Snowmelt is causing additional rises on the Skwentna and Yentna Rivers. Minor flooding is expected through the week.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues.
* WHERE...Skwentna and Yentna Rivers, and surrounding low-lying areas
* WHEN...Until noon AKDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including public boat landings and low-lying airstrips.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High water, lowland flooding and inundation of low structures will continue in this area. - For Skwentna River at Skwentna: Forecast: Bankfull conditions around 41 feet are expected through the week.
-For Yentna River near Yentna Station: Forecast: A crest around 21 feet is expected through mid- week. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
- If you live near or along the Skwentna and Yentna Rivers stay alert and be prepared to move property to higher ground.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 4:07PM MDT until June 28 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
entry.summary:

* WHEN...Until 400 AM MDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Farmland inundation
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM MDT, emergency management continues to report flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Medanales and Chili. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
